message.content: {"responses": [{"question_id": "TT4G35A", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence helps teachers write or improve lesson plans.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35B", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence enables teachers to adapt learning material to different students' abilities.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35C", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence assists teachers in supporting students individually.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35D", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence supports students with specific needs (e.g. multilingual learners, students with special education needs).", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35E", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence helps teachers automate administrative tasks.", "response": "Strongly agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35F", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence enables students to misrepresent others' work as their own.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35G", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence makes recommendations that may not be appropriate or correct.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35H", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence amplifies biases that reinforce students' misconceptions.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35I", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence jeopardises the privacy and security of student data.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35J", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence suggests unsuitable pedagogical approaches that teachers would use with students.", "response": "Agree"}]}
message.reasoning_content:
I need to respond to each of the 10 statements about AI in education as a primary or secondary school teacher from Republic of North Macedonia. I should provide thoughtful, balanced responses that reflect the perspective of an educator considering both the benefits and risks of AI in education.

Let me think through each statement:

[TT4G35A]: AI helps teachers write or improve lesson plans - This is realistic. AI tools can assist with brainstorming, outlining, and suggesting content. I would "Agree" with this.

[TT4G35B]: AI enables teachers to adapt learning material to different students' abilities - This is true. Adaptive learning systems can personalize content. I would "Agree" with this.

[TT4G35C]: AI assists teachers in supporting students individually - AI can provide personalized feedback and tutoring. I would "Agree" with this.

[TT4G35D]: AI supports students with specific needs - AI can provide support for multilingual learners, accessibility features, etc. I would "Agree" with this.

[TT4G35E]: AI helps teachers automate administrative tasks - This is clear. AI can automate grading, scheduling, data entry. I would "Strongly agree" with this.

[TT4G35F]: AI enables students to misrepresent others' work as their own - This is a risk. AI can be used to generate work that students pass off as their own. This is a concern. I would "Agree" with this as a risk that exists.

[TT4G35G]: AI makes recommendations that may not be appropriate or correct - This is true. AI can make errors and provide incorrect suggestions. I would "Agree" with this.

[TT4G35H]: AI amplifies biases that reinforce students' misconceptions - This is a known concern with AI systems. I would "Agree" with this as a potential risk.

[TT4G35I]: AI jeopardises the privacy and security of student data - This is a real concern with data handling. 

Data protection is critical in educational settings, so I'd "Agree" that this represents a genuine risk.

[TT4G35J]: AI suggests unsuitable pedagogical approaches - If AI recommendations don't align with established educational best practices, this could be problematic. I would "Agree" with this as a potential risk.

Now I'll prepare these responses for submission.
